text: A series of tornadoes affected the Southeastern United States on Easter Sunday and Monday, April 12â€“13, 2020. 15 total watches were produced during the course of the event, two of which were designated Particularly Dangerous Situations. With at least 30 deaths reported, it was the deadliest tornado outbreak in the U.S. since the April 2014 tornado outbreak. Access to electricity was downed for nearly 1.3 million people in the tornado outbreak. ==References== Category:Tornado outbreaks Category:Tornadoes in the United States Category:2020 disasters in the United States Category:April 2020 events Category:2020 in weather
title: 2020 Easter tornado outbreak
